content.title: odds of tube delay
topContent: Creating an intertative page that lets users know details on london tube delays. Usig ES6 Javascrip to create an engaging tube map to show the various tube lins on click. Displaying data in a presentable way that is easy to read and a engage with, through the use of drop downs and toggles. This page was used as marketing piece for City AM, and the Londonist, links available below.

content.title: lightbox
topContent: Lightbox is small javascript library used to overlay images on top of the current page. It's easy to set up and works on all browers. Using vanilla JavaScript only, no extra libraries needed. Items can be grouped and captions and image count options can be set. Full instructions are available along with a download from my github.

content.title: portfolio
topContent: Using React JavaScript library to create this portfolio website. Combining react knowledge with Next Js to make use of server rendering, static exporting and routing. Building in a component based way approach, making use of state and passing data as props. Storing content in json files to make use of component based templates, so components can be re used.

content.title: glossary search
topContent: Using ES6 javaScript to loop through data and provide a search functionality that highlights matching words when typed. Users can click letters to bring up matching words of type the words. Using an mvc patttern to keep the code oragnised and clean. Working with the designers to talk through functionality and discussing any issues that may arise from the inital design.

content.title: lightbox
topContent: Using vue js to create a lightbox with vue transitions to create a fade effect one the slider is in action. Making use the vue syntax to loop through an array of objects that holds the lightbox data. Using click events and basic logic to move next and prev throug the slider.
